body:
Hi everybody

I have a question. If somebody can explain it to me. In fact, I ran a simple analysis 3 times and I got a little different values for illumination. so if I want to compare different cases with each other I should run all of them at once? and after how many runs does it approach to real values?



thanks

replies.body:
Farzane,

Your question rise quite a few times in the forum under different "shapes".

See [this](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/different-results-for-one-situation) and [this](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/page/search-results?cx=007664031582976519548%3A0mtws3t01h4&cof=FORID%3A10&ie=UTF-8&q=Stochastic+radiance&sa=Search&siteurl=www.grasshopper3d.com%2F&ref=www.grasshopper3d.com%2Fgroup%2Fladybug%2Fforum%2Ftopic%2Fshow%3Fid%3D2985220%253ATopic%253A1418152%26xg_source%3Dmsg&ss=4922j3167922j15) and [this](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/unpredictable-behaviour-of-lbhb-components) and ... as examples of it.

As for Real Values, no answer will satisfy your expectations. Simulations do what you ask them to do, under your definitions and assumptions. So it is mostly up to you (or the user) how "accurate" the results will be.

-A.
